translation.text: Airport & South Line, Bankstown Line, Blue Mountains Line, Central Coast & Newcastle Line, Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line, Inner West & Leppington Line, North Shore Line, Northern Line, South Coast Line, Southern Highlands Line, Western Line

With the current weather conditions affecting roads and public transport across Greater Sydney, you are urged to plan ahead.

If possible you should work from home and avoid unnecessary travel, particularly in flood affected areas. 
For further details go to  transportnsw.info/news/2021/flood-update-avoid-unnecessary-travel

Train services are being delayed travelling away from the City due to track equipment repairs at North Sydney. A frequent train service is in operation and trains are moving slowly through the affected area. Please allow extra  travel time, check Station information screens and transport apps for service updates as trains may depart from different platforms.

Trains have been suspended between Schofields and Richmond in both directions due to flooding in the area. Richmond trains will terminate at and commence from Schofields.

Direct buses are operating between Richmond and Schofields in both directions.  Buses are also operating between Windsor, Riverstone and Schofields stations, however, these buses will not operate to or from Richmond. Buses are unable to access Vineyard, Mulgrave, Clarendon and East Richmond stations due to road closures in the area. Delays are expected. Please listen to announcements and check station information screens for service updates. Please continue to allow plenty of additional travel time.

With the current weather conditions affecting roads and public transport across Greater Sydney, we are urging customers to plan ahead.
If possible customers should work from home and avoid unnecessary travel particularly in flood affected areas.
For the latest go to transportnsw.info

Train services are running to a reduced frequency due to a train requiring mechanical repairs earlier. You can also utilise local bus routes 525 & 526. Please allow additional travel time, listen to announcements and check information screens and transport apps for updates.  At this stage there is no forecast of when services will return to normal.  Further updates will be provided as information becomes available.
Delays due to temporary speed restrictions caused by wet weather conditions.  Please allow additional travel time, check information screens and listen to announcements.
Central Coast & Newcastle Line - Partial Closure

Buses are replacing trains between Fassifern and Newcastle Interchange in both directions due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek. A train service is running in both directions between Newcastle Interchange and Broadmeadow only. 

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen. Please delay any non-essential travel. If you must travel allow plenty of additional travel time.

Buses replace trains between Newcastle Interchange, Maitland and Scone/Dungog due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate.

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen.
Please avoid non-essential travel, if you must travel please allow plenty of extra travel time.

Cancelled due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate and between Maitland and Dungog/ Scone. 

A limited number of replacement buses are in operation. 

Please avoid any non-essential travel or make your own arrangements if possible. If you must travel, please allow plenty of additional travel time.
The second, third and fifth carriages of this train are locked off and not accessible. Please board another carriage of this train

This train is delayed and will not stop at Redfern and will now terminate at Central platform 11 due to heavy rainfall and wet weather conditions

Please change at Central to continue your journey
.
Services Town Hall, Wynyard & the North Shore depart Central platform 16.

City Circle services first stop Town Hall depart from platform 17.

City Circle services first stop Museum depart from platforms 20/21.

Services to Martin Place, Kings Cross, Edgecliff & Bondi Junction depart from platform 24.

Please allow additional travel time.

Please take extra care on the platform during platform renewal works and stand behind the yellow line on the platform prior to boarding your train.
Station Update - Clarendon, East Richmond, Mulgrave and more
Due to local flooding, rail replacement buses are unable to access Vineyard, Mulgrave, Clarendon and East Richmond stations. Please avoid travelling in the affected areas.

There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6049959

From 11 January to end-December 2021, the escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 Light Rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works. 

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 to 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 to 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry. 

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

Buses are replacing trains between Morisset and Newcastle Interchange due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek.

Please allow additional travel time.
Due to station redevelopment work some platforms have reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platform

Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
